item.text: Add File Commander to Main Menu
item.description: Add File Commander to the Main Menu list of options.

item.text: Add File Commander to Extensions Menu
item.description: Add File Commander to the Extensions Menu list of options.
Select the starting/initial column to be activated on File Commander start up.
Select the default directory to be used if the left column directory is not saved.
Select the default directory to be used if the right column directory is not saved.
Save the left column directory location on exit.
Save the right column directory location on exit.
Default sort order for directories in the left column
Default sort order for directories in the right column.
Default sort order for files in the left column.
Default sort order for files in the right column.
Select 'Yes' to show directories at the top/start of the list, or select 'No' to show files first.
Select 'Yes' to show the current directory in the list of directories. Note that File Commander must be restarted for this change to take effect.
Select 'Yes' to use the number keys for quick selection of files / directories, select 'No' to use the number keys for MENU option shortcuts.
Filter files to be listed by the defined extension. Note that the symbol '(*)' will appear in the title if filtering is in effect.
A comma separated list of extensions to be used for 'My Extension' setting of 'Filter extension'. Enter the extension names without a leading dot (.).
Select 'Yes' to display unknown files in the File Commander file viewer, select 'No' to not process unknown files.
Select 'Yes' to set the cursor position to the end of the line when editing a text file. Select 'No' to set the cursor to the start of the line.
Time between slides in image viewer slide show.
Select 'Yes' to continuously display all images in a loop, or select 'No' to display all images once and then stop.
Select how long to display status messages.
Show task messages if File Commander is not running and all task are completed.
Show script messages if a background script ends. If the script has additional output then this will also be shown.
Select how long to display the task and script message pop up.
Default CPU priority (nice) for executed scripts. This can reduce the system load so that scripts do not interfere with the rest of the system. (higher values = lower priority)
Default I/O priority (ionice) for executed scripts. This can reduce the system load so that scripts do not interfere with the rest of the system. (higher values = lower priority)
Set the number of lines to be saved for 'stout' and 'sterr' output in scripts.
Select 'Yes' to split tasks into separate actions.
